page.title: 09Primary Schools.
page.content: There are two infant schools in Sidmouth,{Manstone}and{All Saints.}All Saints has 92 children between the ages of 4 and 7. The school has been open for 47 years, housed first of all in All Saints School Hall and later at its present site in Vicarage Road. Manstone School was built in 1936. They have 133 children between the ages of 4 and 7. Children from both of these schools transfer to{St. Nicholas School,}where they are taught until the age of eleven. St. Nicholas is a school of 320 pupils, who are taught in ten classes. Until 1966 this was the home of the local Secondary Modern school. At the age of 11, pupils from St. Nicholas transfer to{Sidmouth College, which is an 11-18 Comprehensive school.
